snippet: The retail chain fell short of analysts’ expectations in the quarter and said full-year results would be at the low end of its previous guidance.
abstract: Target falls short of analysts’ expectations in the second quarter and says full-year results will be at the low end of its previous guidance; quarterly profit was $611 million, or 95 cents a share, down 13 percent from $704 million, or $1.06 a share, in year-ago quarter; revenue rose 2 percent to $17.12 billion.
lead_paragraph: The retail chain fell short of analysts’ expectations in the quarter and said full-year results would be at the low end of its previous guidance.

headline.main: Profit Falls 13% at Target, and It Lowers Expectations
headline.print_headline: Profit Falls 13% at Target, and It Lowers Expectations
